memory_items.title: Use Proper Object Interaction Syntax
memory_items.description: Use correct syntax for interacting with objects and containers.
memory_items.content: When attempting to pick up or manipulate objects, use precise syntax such as 'pick up [object] from [location]' or 'use [tool] on [object]'. Avoid ambiguous or repetitive commands that may not match the environment's expected input format.

memory_items.title: Ensure Object Availability Before Interaction
memory_items.description: Verify that objects are accessible and in the correct location before attempting to interact with them.
memory_items.content: Before trying to pick up or use an object, confirm its presence and location in the environment. If an object is not in the current room or inventory, navigate to the correct location first.

memory_items.title: Understand Task Requirements
memory_items.description: Clarify the specific actions required to complete the task.
memory_items.content: For tasks involving conductivity testing, understand that the correct procedure involves using a circuit setup (e.g., battery, wire, and conductive material) and observing the resulting electrical current or light output.

memory_items.title: Focus on the Correct Object Before Action
memory_items.description: Focus on the object before attempting to interact with it.
memory_items.content: Before performing any action on an object, ensure that it is in focus. This helps the environment recognize which object is being manipulated, especially when multiple objects are present.

memory_items.title: Avoid Redundant or Ineffective Actions
memory_items.description: Minimize repetitive or ineffective commands that do not contribute to task completion.
memory_items.content: Avoid repeatedly attempting to pick up or use an object without first ensuring that the necessary conditions (e.g., object location, availability) are met. This reduces unnecessary steps and improves efficiency.

query:
Task Description:
Your task is to determine which of the two inclined planes (plastic, cloth) has the least friction. After completing your experiment, focus on the inclined plane with the least friction.

trajectory.observation: You teleport to the workshop.

This room is called the workshop. In it, you see: 
	the agent
	a substance called air
	an inclined plane with a cloth surface
	an inclined plane with a plastic surface
	a steel block
	a stopwatch, which is deactivated. 
	a table. On the table is: a battery, a blue wire, a green light bulb, which is off, a orange wire, a red light bulb, which is off, a red wire, a switch, which is off, a yellow light bulb, which is off.
	a ultra low temperature freezer. The ultra low temperature freezer door is closed. 
You also see:
	A door to the hallway (that is open)

trajectory.action: focus on inclined plane with cloth surface and inclined plane with plastic surface
trajectory.observation: No known action matches that input.
You focus on the steel block.

memory_items.title: Proper Use of Focus Command
memory_items.description: Use the focus command correctly to interact with objects.
memory_items.content: The focus command should be used on individual objects, not multiple objects at once. Attempting to focus on multiple objects simultaneously may result in an invalid action.

memory_items.title: Identify Required Tools for Experiment
memory_items.description: Identify and use the necessary tools to perform the experiment.
memory_items.content: To determine friction on inclined planes, a steel block and a stopwatch are essential. Ensure these tools are available and in use before proceeding with the experiment.

memory_items.title: Systematic Exploration of the Environment
memory_items.description: Explore the environment systematically to locate necessary objects.
memory_items.content: Navigating to the correct room (e.g., workshop) is crucial to access the inclined planes and other required objects. Always check all available doors and rooms before starting the experiment.

memory_items.title: Understand the Experiment Setup
memory_items.description: Understand the setup required for the experiment.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to measure friction, ensure that the inclined planes are properly positioned and accessible. Confirm that the steel block can be placed on each plane and that the stopwatch is functional.

memory_items.title: Follow the Correct Procedure for Measuring Friction
memory_items.description: Follow the correct procedure to measure and compare friction on different surfaces.
memory_items.content: Place the steel block on each inclined plane, use the stopwatch to measure the time it takes for the block to slide down, and compare the results to determine which surface has the least friction.

memory_items.title: Use Correct Action Syntax
memory_items.description: Use the correct action syntax to interact with objects.
memory_items.content: Always use the correct action format, such as 'pick up [object] from [container]' or 'focus on [object]'. Avoid ambiguous or incorrect phrasing that may not match the environment's expected commands.

memory_items.title: Verify Object Availability
memory_items.description: Ensure the object is accessible before attempting to interact with it.
memory_items.content: Before trying to pick up or focus on an object, confirm that it is present in the current location and not already in the inventory. Use 'look in [container]' to check contents.

memory_items.title: Understand Object Interaction Limits
memory_items.description: Some objects cannot be interacted with directly and require specific actions.
memory_items.content: Not all objects can be picked up or focused on directly. If an action fails, consider alternative methods like using tools, opening containers, or checking if the object is in the inventory.

memory_items.title: Avoid Redundant Actions
memory_items.description: Avoid repetitive actions that do not contribute to the task progress.
memory_items.content: Focus on actions that move the task forward, such as examining objects, opening containers, or using tools. Avoid repeatedly attempting the same action without adapting the strategy.

memory_items.title: Check Inventory Before Attempting to Pick Up
memory_items.description: Check the inventory to avoid picking up objects that are already in possession.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to pick up an object, check the inventory to ensure it is not already present. This prevents redundant actions and potential errors.

memory_items.content: To melt a substance, locate a heat source like an oven or fire pit and use it to apply heat to the substance.

memory_items.title: Avoid Repeated and Ineffective Navigation Attempts
memory_items.description: Minimize unnecessary navigation attempts by focusing on available objects and their locations.
memory_items.content: Instead of repeatedly trying to navigate to an object, use 'look around' or 'look in' to determine its location and interact with it directly.

memory_items.title: Follow the Correct Sequence for State Change Tasks
memory_items.description: Adhere to the sequence of focusing on the object, manipulating it, and waiting for the state change.
memory_items.content: To successfully melt a substance, first focus on it, then apply the necessary action (e.g., heating), and wait for the state change to occur.

query:
Task Description:
Your task is to measure the melting point of chocolate, which is located around the kitchen. First, focus on the thermometer. Next, focus on the chocolate. If the melting point of chocolate is above 50.0 degrees celsius, focus on the red box. If the melting point of chocolate is below 50.0 degrees celsius, focus on the green box. The boxes are located around the kitchen.
